I think about that viewing a documentary about space.

of course, the rope would be binding because it could make knots into parts of spaceship.

the jet pack is very convenient, but if you must go out retrieve modules at high speed you can lose your ship quickly.

The rope would also be useful for rescue missions.
Certainly useful. I did a tethered spacewalk with KAS once. Shame the rope is a single straight line which goes through the station...

Computationally, modelling a rope is very expensive. It's essentially a chain of sticks with hinges, the more sticks the closer to reality. Is that worth the processor real-estate just to have prettier EVA?

KAS only offers a straight cable. That's simple, but looks like crap. A real rope bends and twists, looking great but at great computational cost.
You could string a series of small KAS attachment nodes to approximate a rope.
